title: ISic000186. Fragment of a later Roman Latin inscription
body:
Facsimile Images

[---i]acet +[---]
[---]((:)) Ioan(nes) ((:)) c̣[---]

Apparatus criticus

Text from autopsy; Bivona: I]ACET B[---]; the trace on the stone is compatible with S, preceded by a slight vacat; B is wholly implausible.

translation

commentary

Ferrua proposes that IOAN is the name of the consul of either 467 CE (Puseo et Ioanne conns.) or 538 CE (Fl. Ioanne cons. per Orientem), presumably making this a dated funerary inscription.

bibliography

  • 1980.0529 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 108 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • Ferrua 1982-1983 22 no.74 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001996
  • Bivona 1975-1976 553 no.19 tav.9 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002140
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
